document_metadata.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: TFEB is a basic helix-loop-helix leucine zipper transcription factor originally associated with renal carcinoma [30].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: More recently, TFEB was identified as the transcription factor that binds to a promoter motif responsible for coordinating the expression of lysosomal genes, or the CLEAR element [1]. The coordinated lysosomal expression and regulation (CLEAR) network consists of genes involved in processes such as autophagy, lysosomal biogenesis, lysosomal exocytosis, endocytosis, and membrane repair [31].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In vitro studies have shown that enhancing the ALP through TFEB overexpression reduces HTT protein aggregation in cells expressing huntingtin with the polyglutamine expansion [1,7].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: More recently, TFEB was identified as the transcription factor that binds to a promoter motif responsible for coordinating the expression of lysosomal genes, or the CLEAR element [1]. The coordinated lysosomal expression and regulation (CLEAR) network consists of genes involved in processes such as autophagy, lysosomal biogenesis, lysosomal exocytosis, endocytosis, and membrane repair [31].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: More recently, TFEB was identified as the transcription factor that binds to a promoter motif responsible for coordinating the expression of lysosomal genes, or the CLEAR element [1]. citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Overexpressing TFEB or inducing its nuclear translocation erases this deficit and ameliorates â-synuclein pathology [8,56,57].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Overexpressing TFEB or inducing its nuclear translocation erases this deficit and ameliorates â-synuclein pathology [8,56,57].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: More recently, TFEB was identified as the transcription factor that binds to a promoter motif responsible for coordinating the expression of lysosomal genes, or the CLEAR element [1]. The coordinated lysosomal expression and regulation (CLEAR) network consists of genes involved in processes such as autophagy, lysosomal biogenesis, lysosomal exocytosis, endocytosis, and membrane repair [31].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: TFEB was identified as a main player in coordinating autophagy through positively regulating autophagosome formation and autophagosomeâlysosome fusion [2].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: TFEB was identified as a main player in coordinating autophagy through positively regulating autophagosome formation and autophagosomeâlysosome fusion [2].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In addition, it enhances cellular clearance through lysosomal exocytosis, a process mediated by activation of the lysosomal Ca2+ channel MCOLN1 [12].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Through such communication between the lysosome and nucleus, TFEB regulates metabolism and cellular clearance (Figure 3).

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Through such communication between the lysosome and nucleus, TFEB regulates metabolism and cellular clearance (Figure 3).

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: However, conditions of stress, such as starvation or lysosomal dysfunction, result in TFEB nuclear translocation, where it promotes the transcription of its target genes [1,2].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In vitro studies have shown that enhancing the ALP through TFEB overexpression reduces HTT protein aggregation in cells expressing huntingtin with the polyglutamine expansion [1,7].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In vitro studies have shown that enhancing the ALP through TFEB overexpression reduces HTT protein aggregation in cells expressing huntingtin with the polyglutamine expansion [1,7].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: TFEB was also identified as the downstream mediator and transcriptional target of PGC-1 alpha, which was shown to improve neurological function when overexpressed in a mouse model of HD [7].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Overexpressing TFEB or inducing its nuclear translocation erases this deficit and ameliorates â-synuclein pathology [8,56,57].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Overexpressing TFEB or inducing its nuclear translocation erases this deficit and ameliorates â-synuclein pathology [8,56,57].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Furthermore, â-synuclein was found to bind to TFEB through coimmunoprecipitation, sequestering the transcription factor in the cytoplasm and preventing its activation [8].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Trehalose, a disaccharide, is able to activate TFEB, evidenced by its nuclear translocation upon treatment, and results in reduced cell death in MPP+ intoxicated cells [56].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: Trehalose, a disaccharide, is able to activate TFEB, evidenced by its nuclear translocation upon treatment, and results in reduced cell death in MPP+ intoxicated cells [56].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In addition, TFEB has recently been shown to play a role in mitophagy [61].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: With respect to tau, enhancing the ALP through exogenous TFEB expression in the brain dramatically reduces tau pathology, neurodegeneration, and behavioral deficits in the rTg4510 mouse model [10].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: With respect to tau, enhancing the ALP through exogenous TFEB expression in the brain dramatically reduces tau pathology, neurodegeneration, and behavioral deficits in the rTg4510 mouse model [10].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: With respect to tau, enhancing the ALP through exogenous TFEB expression in the brain dramatically reduces tau pathology, neurodegeneration, and behavioral deficits in the rTg4510 mouse model [10].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: The proposed mechanism of action in this study operates via a TFEBâPTENâAktâmTORâTFEB feedback regulatory loop, where TFEB induces the ALP through upregulation of PTEN and inhibition of Akt and mTOR, which further activates TFEB [10].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: For amyloid pathology, TFEB expression in astrocytes facilitates a reduction in AÎ² plaque pathology in the APP/PS1 mouse model by the proposed mechanism of astrocyte uptake and lysosomal degradation of AÎ² [9].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: For amyloid pathology, TFEB expression in astrocytes facilitates a reduction in AÎ² plaque pathology in the APP/PS1 mouse model by the proposed mechanism of astrocyte uptake and lysosomal degradation of AÎ² [9].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In the case of LOAD patient-derived monocytes, lysosomal enzymes and AÎ² degradative capacity are reduced compared to healthy donors, likely owing to a decrease in TFEB transcripts and nuclear localization caused by miR128 upregulation [77].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In the case of LOAD patient-derived monocytes, lysosomal enzymes and AÎ² degradative capacity are reduced compared to healthy donors, likely owing to a decrease in TFEB transcripts and nuclear localization caused by miR128 upregulation [77].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

links.evidence: In several prion models, autophagy is activated through both mTOR and Beclin 1 signaling pathways [88,89], and ALP activators such as rapamycin and trehalose decrease PrPSc in vitro and in vivo [90,91].

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.

citation.name: The Autophagy-Lysosomal Pathway in Neurodegeneration: A TFEB Perspective.
